oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Dia!kwain (David Hoesar) (V)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A ceremony performed with the Brachycerus (African Ground Weevil) in order to preserve young babies from convulsions. In the Katkop dialect by Dia!kwain (L V.-23. 5833-5840). The Brachycerus used to cure illness in little children. By /han=kasso (L VIII.-21. 7822-7825). 1) p.5832v: this story was told to Dia!kwain by his mother (=kamme-an); the beetle of the story ticks like a clock and is shaped like a tortoise, 2) This story is found in Book V-23.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Custom observed with Bushman children, when too young to walk
